tizo_trico wrote:
> Ok St.Ack; I am really sorry, I had not seen the hcc.properties section.
>
> I could run a controller instance, only to see that its functionality
> can be accesed by JMX with jconsole, because I did not yet install a
> JNDI server. I think that, to people that is not got used to work with
> JMX (as me), it would be important to add that the example code in
> http://crawler.archive.org/hcc/apidocs/overview-summary.html should be
> executed with the option -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.
Thank you for that.  Seems like you don't need this if you are doing the 
management remotely.  Thanks for pointing it out.  I'll add it to the doc.
>
> And finally, a question: can JBOSS's jndi service be downloaded and
> installed on its own, and not with the application server?
I'm not sure.  Running full JBOSS just to do a directory server is 
indeed over the top.  On the other hand, its a no brainer.  You just 
start it up and it just works -- and it has a UI so you can see whats 
going on.  That said, there's a plethora of JNDI providers out there.  
The apache directory server looks kinda nice. I haven't tried it and 
again, looks a bit more than you probably want.

St.Ack
